item.title: Calculate PCA by hand
item.author: Author
item.description: Here I am going to show you how to calculate PCA by hand! But before we dive deep into PCA, there are two prerequisite concepts we need to understand: Variance/Covariance Find eigenvectors and eigenvalues If you already understand those two concepts, you can skip this part. Â Prerequisite 1: Variance/Covariance Variance Variance measures how far a set of numbers is spread out from their average value. The sample variance is defined as $$ s^2 = \frac{\sum(x_i - \bar x)^2}{n - 1} $$
